docs.text: OSU Extension CMS Developer Documentation This site contains documentation and information for web developers. If you are a content creator, please see the main CMS documentation .

docs.text: Deploying to Acquia Cloud ... Pulling Updates from Acquia Cloud ...
docs.title: Deployment

docs.text: Git Repository Location The code repository for the CMS is located on Github: https://github.com/osu-eesc/extd8 Branching strategy We have not yet discussed a branching strategy, but when we do, it will be described here. Coding Style requirements All code committed to the extd8 repository must meet all Drupal coding standards . Commit Message requirements All commits to the extd8 repository must have commit messages that meet the following requirements: Start with a JIRA ticket number followed by a colon (:) and a space (e.g. "ABC-123: ") Contain an explanatory message that starts with a capital letter. End with a period (.) See this A List Apart article for tips on writing useful commit messages: The Art of the Commit .
docs.title: Source Control

docs.text: Full MkDocs Documentation For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Installation Clone the documentation Git repository from https://github.com/osu-eesc/cms With HomeBrew installed, run brew install mkdocs Making Updates Navigate to the folder in the documentation site containing mkdocs.yml Run mkdocs serve As you make changes to documentation pages, a live preview will be available at http://127.0.0.1:8000/ Building and Deploying the Documentation Site After writing updates to the documentation, Navigate to the folder in the documentation site containing mkdocs.yml Run mkdocs build --clean Commit and push all changes
docs.title: Maintaining Documentation

docs.text: Clone the documentation Git repository from https://github.com/osu-eesc/cms With HomeBrew installed, run brew install mkdocs

docs.title: Making Updates

docs.title: Building and Deploying the Documentation Site
